text.headline: Bayes' theorem
text.text: In probability theory and statistics, Bayes' theorem (alternatively Bayes' law or Bayes' rule), named after Thomas Bayes, describes the probability of an event, based on prior knowledge of conditions that might be related to the event.

text.headline: Least Square Theory
text.text: by French mathematician Adrien-Marie Legendre. This theory, which you will learn about in our Regression unit, helps in data fitting.

text.headline: Perceptron
text.text: type of linear classifier invented by American psychologist Frank Rosenblatt that underlies advances in deep learning.

text.headline: Markov Chains
text.text: named after Russian mathematician Andrey Markov, is used to describe a sequence of possible events based on a previous state.
